text.section: The Center shall serve as a clearinghouse for information and materials that may be pertinent to clean energy technology, education, and deployment in the State, for persons engaged in the clean energy industry as developers, manufacturers, and installers, as well as for consumers and financial institutions, including information on available federal, State, and private financial assistance and technical assistance.

The Center may:
cooperate with and provide assistance to local governments, instrumentalities, and research entities in the State; and
coordinate clean energy technology development, education, and deployment activities with programs of the federal government and of governmental units and public and private entities in and outside the State.
